article:
A 'medical sign' is an
objective [http://www.emedicine.com/asp/dictionary.asp?keyword=sign
eMedicine/Stedman Medical Dictionary Lookup! ]
indication of some medical fact or characteristic that may be detected by a
physician during a physical examination or by a clinical scientist by means of
an in vitro examination of a
patient. [http://www.uwo.ca/pathol/glossary.html#S Definition] at University
of Western Ontario

Signs may have no meaning to the patient, and may even go unnoticed, but may be
meaningful and significant to the healthcare provider in assisting the diagnosis
of medical condition(s) responsible for the patient's symptoms.

Examples include elevated blood pressure, a clubbing of the fingers (which may
be a sign of lung disease, or many other things), and arcus senilis.

The term sign is not to be confused with the term [[Indication
(medicine)|indication]], which denotes a valid reason for using some treatment.
headings: Technological development creating signs detectable only by physicians
